As an AI language model I do not have personal beliefs but in regards to your statement, while it is true that nuclear weapons have been credited with preventing major wars for decades, it is still important to consider the long-term consequences of relying on nuclear deterrence strategies.

Firstly, the possession of nuclear weapons heightens the risk of accidents, miscalculations, and breakdowns in relations between countries. Such events could easily trigger a catastrophic nuclear exchange, leading to horrific loss of life and catastrophic consequences for the environment.

Secondly, the existence of nuclear weapons promotes an arms race, leading to the perceived need for more advanced and destructive weapons that can quickly spiral out of control. As demonstrated by the Cuban Missile Crisis, the deterrence approach can intensify tensions and lead to a heightened international crisis that could have disastrous consequences.

Instead of relying solely on deterrence, policymakers should prioritize disarmament and other alternatives to ensure international security. Some alternatives include addressing underlying social, political, and economic issues that trigger conflict or promoting more comprehensive disarmament agreements globally.

Additionally, intensified efforts can be made towards strengthening international institutions and improving diplomatic relations, building trust between countries and promoting a culture of cooperation, and conflict resolution.

While the goal of disarmament may seem ambitious, it is a fundamentally important one that policymakers should pursue as an essential way to promote long-lasting peace and security in the world.
